classes.name: Solo
classes.description: War-torn and recycled, these warriors come from the bloodiest battles, serving as mercenaries or soldiers in warfare, losing much of their humanity in the process. As a result of this, many trauma-ridden survivors that make it back to civilization can only find careers in combat, such as becoming hitmen or assassins. Others take a more noble path and become police officers. Most are machine, replacing their lost organic tissue, whether purposeful or not, with modern technology to enhance their combative abilities.

ability.name: One-Man Army
ability.description: Allows for the player to equip up to six cybermods without any Cyberpsychosis checks. They also gain the ability to {Combobulate}, allowing them to reroll a cybermod's installation to gain a more favorable outcome, once per cybermod installation.

cybermods: [Operating System Choice] + 3 randomized choices d10, 2 choices d10.

classes.name: Fixer
classes.description: Well aware of the underground crime taking place in the world, Fixers are known to deal in smuggling, brokerage, organize jobs, and make deals criminal organizations and gangs. They know shady business better than anyone, and have connections that commonfolk could only dream of.

ability.name: Negotiator
ability.description: Get a large discount when buying from vendors. Allows for rewards to be rerolled one time per session. Grants the ability to {Leverage}, allowing the user to roll a D20 to request backup once per session.

cybermods: [Operating System Choice] + one choice d10 + Choose one Cybermod.

classes.name: Netrunner
classes.description: Talented with a knack for cheating the system, the Netrunner never feels at home in the new world necessarily, though when they are in the Net, they are undefeatable, navigating the harsh waters of technoreality. With a talent for uncovering the forbidden, the Netrunner is known for their ability to hack their way through virtual difficulties. With an ever-growing worry for the progression of Artificial Intelligence, the Netrunner is no stranger to risk.

ability.name: Bypasser
ability.description: Gain the ability to infiltrate defenses, otherwise considered impassible. Grants the ability to {Hack} allies or enemies in battle, sacrificing one turn, but ensuring the success of a quickhack. Additionally, gain the ability to {Netrun} outside of combat.

classes.name: Techie
classes.description: A gearhead of the new world who enjoys conceptualizing assembly. These reliable engineers are vital to the survival of many, and as a result do not suffer much with finances. While not as reliable in combat, they do not really have much of a need for combat when they can create robots to fight for them, or rely on their bodyguards to do the beatings.

ability.name: Ripperdoc
ability.description: Gain the ability to {Construct} things and find components. Gain the ability to {Install} Cybermods, granting a bonus towards preventing Cyber Psychosis based on Crafting level. Can attempt to {Improve} or {Repair} equipment, cybermods, or weapons. Requires knowledge. Increases the Crafting cap by 10. Allows one reroll for Cyberpsychosis, if you choose.

civilNotes: A: Roll 2D4 and allocate accordingly between these two stats. Otherwise, record 0.
choices: Gain [Basic Education] or two INT tags.

classes.name: Defiant
classes.description: Rebellious to the ways of the new world, a Defiant is focused on the impact they can have. They have an orientation that hones them in on the humane, rather than the progressiveness of the new world.
civilNotes: A: If Rockerboy, roll 1D4 and allocate accordingly between these two stats. Otherwise, record 0.
B: Roll 1D4 and allocate accordingly between these two stats. If Media or Whistleblower, roll an additional 1D4.

subclasses.name: Media
subclasses.description: These people report the news and the horrifying reality of the shady dealings of corporations. Medias are known to have crosshairs on their back for this reason. These masters of media can singlehandedly devastate and inspire action against authority.

ability.name: Dead Man's Switch
ability.description: Gain the ability to utilize Intimidation, Persuasion, or Performance interchangeably. Additionally, may reroll an action of this nature once if it threatens the life of the user, once per session.

subclasses.name: Whistleblower
subclasses.description: These people hold high roles within companies, though have different plans than their overlords. With their hiatus, their goal is to bring down companies and organizations from the inside - at the risk of their own lives.

ability.name: Dead Man's Switch
ability.description: Gain the ability to utilize Intimidation, Persuasion, or Performance interchangeably. Additionally, may reroll an action of this nature once if it threatens the life of the user, once per session.

subclasses.name: Rockerboy
subclasses.description: These people are rebels who defy the modern world, focusing on their missions in art and messages. They are catalysts of empathy and justice, even if that means justifying things by their own means.

ability.name: Inspire
ability.description: Gain the ability to {Inspire} another entity one time, per session. This allows the user to roll on behalf of another entity if it fails a skill check. Additionally, if the roll succeeds, it will be guaranteed to crit, if possible.
